ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Otitis Media with Effusion (Left Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Unilateral conductive hearing loss, hypocompliant tympanogram with negative pressure, and autophony following radiation therapy.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian Tube Dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Likely mechanism for the development of effusion given the history of radiation to the tonsil.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing sensitivity and type of hearing loss.
Evaluate speech reception and recognition abilities.
Assess middle ear function and eardrum mobility.
Evaluate retrocochlear function and confirm middle ear status.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with asymmetrical hearing. The right ear shows normal hearing sloping to high-frequency sensorineural loss. The left ear exhibits a low-frequency conductive loss and high-frequency mixed loss. Tympanometry reveals reduced compliance and negative pressure in the left ear, consistent with otitis media with effusion likely secondary to radiation therapy.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (250-2000 Hz) sloping to slight-to-moderate SNHL (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Slight sloping to mild conductive loss (250-1000 Hz), rising to slight at 2000 Hz, sloping to mixed/moderately severe at 3000-4000 Hz. PTA: RE 7 dB HL, LE 40 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 7 dB HL, WRS 92%. Left ear: SRT 35 dB HL, WRS 88%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (Type A). Left ear: Hypocompliant (Type As, 0.2 mL) with negative pressure (-75 daPa).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ear ipsilateral present 500-2000 Hz, absent at 4000 Hz. Left ear ipsilateral and contralateral absent. Right ear contralateral elevated or absent.

counseling_actions: Discuss the relationship between radiation therapy, Eustachian tube dysfunction, and middle ear fluid
Instruct on the use of the Otovent device

escalation.rationale_short: For medical management of otitis media with effusion (Otovent or PE tube) and surveillance post-radiation.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing sensitivity and middle ear status to determine if conductive component resolves.
